metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5465 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read while processing SVG content in "ConvolvePixel". This results in a crash and also allows for otherwise inaccessible memory being copied into SVG graphic content, which could then displayed. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.1, Firefox ESR < 45.9, Firefox ESR < 52.1, and Firefox < 53.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5465` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
